meanings.definition: To speak or utter in a voice that appears to come from a source other than oneself.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor would ventriloquize to make it seem like the puppet was talking.
meanings.sent2: The ventriloquist could ventriloquize so well that the audience believed the doll was alive.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to ventriloquize the rabbit, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to ventriloquize the voices of different characters was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The ventriloquist's talent to ventriloquize made the puppet show unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To throw or project the voice so that it appears to come from a different location.
meanings.sent1: He could ventriloquize his voice to make it seem like it was coming from across the room.
meanings.sent2: The ventriloquist could ventriloquize his voice to make it sound like it was coming from behind the curtain.
meanings.sent3: The ventriloquist decided to ventriloquize his voice to confuse the audience about his location.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to ventriloquize her voice to different parts of the room amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The ventriloquist's skill to ventriloquize his voice added an element of mystery to the performance.

meanings.definition: To manipulate one's voice to create the illusion of a different speaker.
meanings.sent1: She could ventriloquize her voice to sound like a man speaking.
meanings.sent2: The ventriloquist could ventriloquize his voice to mimic famous personalities.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to ventriloquize his voice to imitate a cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: Her talent to ventriloquize her voice to sound like animals amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The ventriloquist's ability to ventriloquize different voices made the show entertaining and engaging.
